analysis: The documents in this cluster primarily concern the withdrawal and reservation of public lands for various specific purposes, including military use, flood control, forest service facilities (lookout stations, ranger stations), soil erosion control, land utilization projects, and other public uses like water reserves and recreational areas. Many of the orders either revoke or modify previous orders related to land classification and withdrawal. A common theme is the temporary nature of these withdrawals, pending further action or specific project completion. The documents frequently cite the Act of June 25, 1910, as amended, as the legal basis for these actions.
title: Public Land Use and Reservation
